result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody A. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jody A. Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jody A. Jones was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Submit a DNA sample.  The Court has waived all DNA-related costs/surcharges.

Defense counsel in this case was court-appointed.  Once the Court receives the bill from Atty. Dolche, the Defendant will be ordered to repay Richland County, with the total amount due immediately.  However, the Defendant may set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court if needed.

Costs in this case are to include repayment of the buy money used by the CI.  The Court has given the DA 30 days to present the amount and has given the Defense the opportunity to object to the amount; if there is an objection, the Court will set a hearing.

Defendant is to follow all rules of probation and engage in, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling or treatment as ordered by the agent.  
Court also orders that the supervising agent give random u.a.s at least once a month during the first year of probation.  

3 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: JOC AMENDED 6-3-14 per Stipulation and Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction to Include Confidential Informant Costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jody A. Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Amend Judgment of Conviction to Include Confidential Informant Costs
for Payment of Court-Appointed Attorney Fees
from Atty. Dolch - request for payment of Dean fees
for payment of court-appointed attorney fees

ADDRESS INFO for Jody A. Jones
Current: 32776 Rustys Ln, Blue River, WI 53518 United States  (Effective: 05-07-2014)
Prior: 32776 Rustys Lane, Blue River, WI 53518

DA, Def, and Atty. Dolche.  Counsel present the court with details of a plea agreement calling for def's plea to count 1 for a withheld sentence with 3 years probation and costs.  DA states she's also requesting reimbursement of the buy money but doesn't have the figure at this time; will present that information in a stipulation at a later date.  Atty. D confirms that the def's intention is to enter a plea and proceed to sentencing.  Def pleads no contest to count 1.  Court's colloquy re plea.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel and def address the court.  Court adopts jt recommendation and orders sentence withheld on count 1 for 3 years probation.  Conditions:  costs, costs of probation, submit DNA sample with surcharge remitted to $0.  Atty. Dolche was court-appointed.  Court orders restitution for the buy money and gives the state 30 days to present the amount; def will have opportunity to objection and, if so, would get a hearing on that.  3 days jail credit.  Def to follow rules of probation and engage in any counseling or treatment as ordered by agent; attend/pay for/successfully complete those programs.  Court also orders that the agent give random u.a. at least once a month during the first year of probation.  Def will be required to repay the costs of counsel.  Court orders that the entire amount of the bill will be due and owing once Atty. Dolche's bill comes in.  DA notes that the buy money is a cost - not restitution per say, and will be entered as such once that amount is known.
Status conference on May 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

SP Conlon, Def, and Atty. Dolch.  Atty. D states that the def will plead NG.  Court states the charge as contained in the information.  May 7th set as date for status.  Status conference scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 10:00 am.
(NO DOCUMENT - SYSTEM-ADDED EVENT DUE TO INFORMATION)

Attorney Leonie Dolch in court with Defendant Jody A. Jones. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty D waives formal reading of the complaint. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Atty D. presents a prelim hearing waiver. Court's colloquy on waiver of prelim. Court accepts waiver of prelim. Court will schedule arraignment for March 19 @ 10.  Arraignment scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
